qas.question: In what year did the last major effort to settle the Cyprus dispute take place?
How many Turkish Cypriots voted for the Annan Plan in 2004?
How many Greek Cypriots voted against the Annan Plan in 2004?
In what year did Cyprus join the European Union?
In 2006 people fled to Cyprus from what country?

context: The Turkish invasion, followed by occupation and the declaration of independence of the TRNC have been condemned by United Nations resolutions, which are reaffirmed by the Security Council every year. The last major effort to settle the Cyprus dispute was the Annan Plan in <a0_0>2004<a0_0/>, drafted by the then Secretary General, Kofi Annan. The plan was put to a referendum in both Northern Cyprus and the Republic of Cyprus. <a1_0>65%<a1_0/> of Turkish Cypriots voted in support of the plan and <a2_0>74%<a2_0/> Greek Cypriots voted against the plan, claiming that it disproportionately favoured the Turkish side. In total, 66.7% of the voters rejected the Annan Plan V. On 1 May <a3_0>2004<a3_0/> Cyprus joined the European Union, together with nine other countries. Cyprus was accepted into the EU as a whole, although the EU legislation is suspended in the territory occupied by Turkey (TRNC), until a final settlement of the Cyprus problem. In July 2006, the island served as a haven for people fleeing <a4_0>Lebanon<a4_0/>, due to the conflict between Israel and Hezbollah (also called "The July War").
